title: Dungeon Descent
data:
***[Trunk](/Trunk "Trunk")-only**: This article pertains to a feature of Crawl which is being tested. It will likely change before the next release, and may even be removed entirely.*

|   |                                                          |
| - | -------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | Mode with a branching, one-way path through the Dungeon. |

**Dungeon Descent** (**Descent**, **Ironman**) is a *Crawl* variant, along with [Dungeon Sprint](/Dungeon_Sprint "Dungeon Sprint"). Descent mode is similar to the main game, but you can never go back up a floor, only down.

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Map](#Map)
- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [4 Gallery](#Gallery)
- [5 History](#History)

## Useful Info

Descent mode has a number of changes from regular *Crawl*:

- When going down a regular set of stairs, you get the **Peek** status that allows you to preview the next floor. During Peek, you can go back up without spending time on the lower floor (note: you still wait 1.5 turns after going back up). You also get to view the location of all 3 stairs, and the surrounding area of said stairs.

  - Using an [escape hatch](/Escape_hatch "Escape hatch") or [shaft](/Shaft "Shaft") does not let you peek, so you get none of the above benefits.
  - Doing anything while you have Peek (besides going up) destroys all upstairs on the level, preventing you from going up again. Using a hatch or shaft will also destroy stairs.
  - [Ignis](/Ignis "Ignis")' Rising Flame ability still lets you go up a floor.

- A **Debt** mechanic is introduced. If you don't have enough [gold](/Gold "Gold"), you can still buy items from a [shop](/Shop "Shop"). Doing so puts you into debt, which prevents you from buying other items until it is cleared. Any gold you collect is used to pay off debt. Debt is exactly equal to `price - current_gold`; there is no interest, and there are no other downsides to going into debt.

- [Runes of Zot](/Runes_of_Zot "Runes of Zot") are optional; [rune locks](/Rune_lock "Rune lock") do not exist.

- The [malevolent force](/Malevolent_force "Malevolent force") mechanic does not exist.

- [Shafts](/Shaft "Shaft") can only drop the player 1 floor.

- Certain [vaults](/Vault "Vault") do not appear.

- [Branch](/Branch "Branch") order and length is adjusted. See below for details.

## Map

New characters start on level one of [the Dungeon](/The_Dungeon "The Dungeon"). [Delvers](/Delver "Delver") start at level two.

Branches separated by a bar (|) are choices you can make, e.g. on D:12, you can enter either [Lair](/Lair "Lair") or [Depths](/Depths "Depths"). Branches in *unbolded italics* indicate that they are not part of the intended progression - you will skip branches if you enter them.

1. [![Dungeon exit.png](/images/a/a8/Dungeon_exit.png)](/File:Dungeon_exit.png) **[The Dungeon](/The_Dungeon "The Dungeon")** (12 levels)
2. [![Lair entry.png](/images/b/b8/Lair_entry.png)](/File:Lair_entry.png) **[The Lair](/The_Lair "The Lair")** (5 levels) | [![Depths entry.png](/images/6/6d/Depths_entry.png)](/File:Depths_entry.png) *The Depths* (4 levels)
3. [![Orc entry.png](/images/3/30/Orc_entry.png)](/File:Orc_entry.png) **[Orcish Mines](/Orcish_Mines "Orcish Mines")** (2 levels) | [![Slime entry.png](/images/0/0a/Slime_entry.png)](/File:Slime_entry.png) *The Slime Pits* (5 levels)
4. One of { [![Swamp entry.png](/images/e/eb/Swamp_entry.png)](/File:Swamp_entry.png) **[The Swamp](/The_Swamp "The Swamp")** OR [![Shoals entry.png](/images/b/b9/Shoals_entry.png)](/File:Shoals_entry.png) **[The Shoals](/The_Shoals "The Shoals")** } (4 levels) | One of { [![Snake entry.png](/images/8/8a/Snake_entry.png)](/File:Snake_entry.png) **[Snake Pit](/Snake_Pit "Snake Pit")** OR [![Spider entry.png](/images/d/dd/Spider_entry.png)](/File:Spider_entry.png) **[Spider's Nest](/Spider%27s_Nest "Spider's Nest")** } (4 levels)
5. [![Elf entry.png](/images/a/a3/Elf_entry.png)](/File:Elf_entry.png) **[Elven Halls](/Elven_Halls "Elven Halls")** (3 levels) | [![Crypt entry.png](/images/5/5d/Crypt_entry.png)](/File:Crypt_entry.png) **[The Crypt](/The_Crypt "The Crypt")** (3 levels)
6. [![Vaults entry.png](/images/c/c5/Vaults_entry.png)](/File:Vaults_entry.png) **[The Vaults](/The_Vaults "The Vaults")** (5 levels)
7. [![Slime entry.png](/images/0/0a/Slime_entry.png)](/File:Slime_entry.png) **[The Slime Pits](/The_Slime_Pits "The Slime Pits")** (5 levels) | [![Depths entry.png](/images/6/6d/Depths_entry.png)](/File:Depths_entry.png) *The Depths* (4 levels)
8. [![Depths entry.png](/images/6/6d/Depths_entry.png)](/File:Depths_entry.png) **[The Depths](/The_Depths "The Depths")** (4 levels)
9. [![Zot entry.png](/images/a/a7/Zot_entry.png)](/File:Zot_entry.png) **[The Realm of Zot](/The_Realm_of_Zot "The Realm of Zot")** (5 levels)

On Zot:5, there is an exit to the end of the game, so the [orb run](/Orb_run "Orb run") only lasts for one floor.

**Special:**

- The [Abyss](/Abyss "Abyss"), [Pandemonium](/Pandemonium "Pandemonium"), and other [portal](/Portal "Portal") levels work like normal. Their portals appear in the usual locations, and you can escape back to where you came.
- Entrances to the [Vestibule of Hell](/Vestibule_of_Hell "Vestibule of Hell") appear in Depths. The Vestibule allows you to go back into Depths. The four hells ([Cocytus](/Cocytus "Cocytus"), [Gehenna](/Gehenna "Gehenna"), [Tartarus](/Tartarus "Tartarus"), [Dis](/Dis "Dis")) have portals back to the Vestibule on every floor, like the regular game.
- The [Temple](/Temple "Temple") and [Tomb](/Tomb "Tomb") do not exist.

With the given branches available, it is possible to get 13 runes of Zot.

## Strategy

Without one of the most important escape tools in *Crawl*, stairs, Descent is naturally harder than the main game. Essentially, you are [shafted](/Shaft "Shaft") when entering each new floor: [resting](/Rest "Rest") is harder, you can't [stair dance](/Stair_dance "Stair dance"), and escaping from dangerous [out-of-depth](/Out-of-depth "Out-of-depth") monsters is difficult. You can no longer "retreat upwards, then go down a different downstair", so you are more reliant on consumables to get out of bad situations.

At the time of writing, there is no compensation to monster or item generation in Descent.

Due to the changes in the Dungeon's layout, there are a few oddities:

- As there is no Temple, you'll find all the [altars](/Altar "Altar") in the main Dungeon.
- Branch entrances are guarded by appropriate monsters. So you can find [hydras](/Hydra "Hydra") and [bog bodies](/Bog_bodies "Bog bodies") near [the Swamp](/The_Swamp "The Swamp")'s entrance in [Orc](/Orc "Orc"), [bone dragons](/Bone_dragon "Bone dragon") and [curse skulls](/Curse_skull "Curse skull") near [the Crypt](/The_Crypt "The Crypt")'s entrance in [Spider](/Spider "Spider"), etc.
- [Kiting](/Kiting "Kiting") is harder, which makes slow enemies like [worms](/Worm "Worm") and [Gastronok](/Gastronok "Gastronok") bigger threats.
- You will need to deal with the [Vaults](/Vaults "Vaults"):5 entry party. Sometimes, a branch entrance may spawn in the center of V:5, but this is not guaranteed.

## Gallery

- [![](/images/thumb/5/5f/DescentMap.png/386px-DescentMap.png)](/File:DescentMap.png)

  **Visual map of descent mode.**

## History

- Descent mode will be added in [trunk](/Trunk "Trunk").

Trunk-only: This article pertains to a feature of Crawl which is being tested. It will likely change before the next release, and may even be removed entirely.
Mode with a branching, one-way path through the Dungeon.

Dungeon Descent (Descent, Ironman) is a Crawl variant, along with Dungeon Sprint. Descent mode is similar to the main game, but you can never go back up a floor, only down.

Contents

  • 1 Useful Info
  • 2 Map
  • 3 Strategy
  • 4 Gallery
  • 5 History

Useful Info

Descent mode has a number of changes from regular Crawl:

  • When going down a regular set of stairs, you get the Peek status that allows you to preview the next floor. During Peek, you can go back up without spending time on the lower floor (note: you still wait 1.5 turns after going back up). You also get to view the location of all 3 stairs, and the surrounding area of said stairs.
    • Using an escape hatch or shaft does not let you peek, so you get none of the above benefits.
    • Doing anything while you have Peek (besides going up) destroys all upstairs on the level, preventing you from going up again. Using a hatch or shaft will also destroy stairs.
    • Ignis' Rising Flame ability still lets you go up a floor.
  • A Debt mechanic is introduced. If you don't have enough gold, you can still buy items from a shop. Doing so puts you into debt, which prevents you from buying other items until it is cleared. Any gold you collect is used to pay off debt. Debt is exactly equal to price - current_gold; there is no interest, and there are no other downsides to going into debt.
  • Runes of Zot are optional; rune locks do not exist.
  • The malevolent force mechanic does not exist.
  • Shafts can only drop the player 1 floor.
  • Certain vaults do not appear.
  • Branch order and length is adjusted. See below for details.

Map

New characters start on level one of the Dungeon. Delvers start at level two.

Branches separated by a bar (|) are choices you can make, e.g. on D:12, you can enter either Lair or Depths. Branches in unbolded italics indicate that they are not part of the intended progression - you will skip branches if you enter them.

  1. The Dungeon (12 levels)
  2. The Lair (5 levels) | The Depths (4 levels)
  3. Orcish Mines (2 levels) | The Slime Pits (5 levels)
  4. One of { The Swamp OR The Shoals } (4 levels) | One of { Snake Pit OR Spider's Nest } (4 levels)
  5. Elven Halls (3 levels) | The Crypt (3 levels)
  6. The Vaults (5 levels)
  7. The Slime Pits (5 levels) | The Depths (4 levels)
  8. The Depths (4 levels)
  9. The Realm of Zot (5 levels)

On Zot:5, there is an exit to the end of the game, so the orb run only lasts for one floor.

Special:

  • The Abyss, Pandemonium, and other portal levels work like normal. Their portals appear in the usual locations, and you can escape back to where you came.
  • Entrances to the Vestibule of Hell appear in Depths. The Vestibule allows you to go back into Depths. The four hells (Cocytus, Gehenna, Tartarus, Dis) have portals back to the Vestibule on every floor, like the regular game.
  • The Temple and Tomb do not exist.

With the given branches available, it is possible to get 13 runes of Zot.

Strategy

Without one of the most important escape tools in Crawl, stairs, Descent is naturally harder than the main game. Essentially, you are shafted when entering each new floor: resting is harder, you can't stair dance, and escaping from dangerous out-of-depth monsters is difficult. You can no longer "retreat upwards, then go down a different downstair", so you are more reliant on consumables to get out of bad situations.

At the time of writing, there is no compensation to monster or item generation in Descent.

Due to the changes in the Dungeon's layout, there are a few oddities:

  • As there is no Temple, you'll find all the altars in the main Dungeon.
  • Branch entrances are guarded by appropriate monsters. So you can find hydras and bog bodies near the Swamp's entrance in Orc, bone dragons and curse skulls near the Crypt's entrance in Spider, etc.
  • Kiting is harder, which makes slow enemies like worms and Gastronok bigger threats.
  • You will need to deal with the Vaults:5 entry party. Sometimes, a branch entrance may spawn in the center of V:5, but this is not guaranteed.

Gallery

  • Visual map of descent mode.

History

  • Descent mode will be added in trunk.
